  16. (* Module [Lazy]: deferred computations *)


  19. (*
  20.    WARNING: some purple magic is going on here.  Do not take this file
  21.    as an example of how to program in OCaml.
  22. *)


  25. (* We make use of two special tags provided by the runtime:
  26.    [lazy_tag] and [forward_tag].

  28.    A value of type ['a Lazy.t] can be one of three things:
  29.    1. A block of size 1 with tag [lazy_tag].  Its field is a closure of
  30.       type [unit -> 'a] that computes the value.
  31.    2. A block of size 1 with tag [forward_tag].  Its field is the value
  32.       of type ['a] that was computed.
  33.    3. Anything else except a float.  This has type ['a] and is the value
  34.       that was computed.
  35.    Exceptions are stored in format (1).
  36.    The GC will magically change things from (2) to (3) according to its
  37.    fancy.

  39.    If OCaml was configured with the -flat-float-array option (which is
  40.    currently the default), the following is also true:
  41.    We cannot use representation (3) for a [float Lazy.t] because
  42.    [caml_make_array] assumes that only a [float] value can have tag
  43.    [Double_tag].

  45.    We have to use the built-in type constructor [lazy_t] to
  46.    let the compiler implement the special typing and compilation
  47.    rules for the [lazy] keyword.
  48. *)

  50. ‌type 'a t = 'a CamlinternalLazy.t

  52. exception Undefined = CamlinternalLazy.Undefined
  53. external make_forward : 'a -> 'a lazy_t = "caml_lazy_make_forward"
  54. external force : 'a t -> 'a = "%lazy_force"

  56. ‌let force_val l = CamlinternalLazy.force_gen ~only_val:true l

  58. ‌let from_fun (f : unit -> 'arg) =
  59.   let x = Obj.new_block Obj.lazy_tag 1 in
  60.   Obj.set_field x 0 (Obj.repr f);
  61.   (Obj.obj x : 'arg t)

  63. ‌let from_val (v : 'arg) =
  64.   let t = Obj.tag (Obj.repr v) in
  65.   if t = Obj.forward_tag || t = Obj.lazy_tag ||
  66.      t = Obj.forcing_tag || t = Obj.double_tag then begin
  67.     make_forward v
  68.   end else begin
  69.     (Obj.magic v : 'arg t)
  70.   end

  72. let is_val (l : 'arg t) = Obj.tag (Obj.repr l) <> Obj.lazy_tag

  74. ‌let map f x =
  75.   lazy (f (force x))

  77. ‌let map_val f x =
  78.   if is_val x
  79.   then from_val (f (force x))
  80.   else lazy (f (force x))
